info.title: SpinalCore Graph API
info.description: Welcome to the reference documentation for the Spinalcore Digital Twin REST API! </br></br>To learn about the common use cases and concept of Spinalcore REST APIs, check out our resource center  (https://resourcecenter.fr.spinalcom.com/ressources-d%C3%A9veloppeur).</br></br>In addition to Spinalcore API Reference, we also provide complete documentation for integrator that need to install and implement Spinalcore Digital Twin Operating System on their built environment (https://resourcecenter.fr.spinalcom.com/ressources-int%C3%A9grateur)

parentId.description: The dynamic ID of the parent node

parentToChildRelationName.description: The name of the relation between the parent and the child

parentToChildRelationType.description: The type of the relation between the parent and the child

addInContext.description: If true the node will be added in the context of the parent node else it will just be added as a child

contextId.description: Required if 'addInContext' is true. The ID of the context to add the node to.

attributeLabel.description: The label of the attribute to update.

attributeNewValue.description: The new value for the attribute, which can be a string, number, or boolean.

categoryName.description: Name of the category to which the attributes belong.

attributes.description: List of attribute updates within the category.

dynamicId.description: Unique identifier for the node, typically used as a dynamic reference.

categories.description: Array of categories with attributes to update for the node.
Array of categories with attributes that were updated for the node.

tags.name: Pub/Sub
tags.description: pubsub api documentation is available at https://resourcecenter.fr.spinalcom.com/ressources-d√©veloppeur/api-sdk-principes/api-pubsub

post.description: Find node object in a specific context

requestBody.description: (optionSearchNodes) this field takes a string that allows us to search either by dynamicId, the staticId or by name, (dynamicId), (staticId), (name) / (optionResult) this field takes a string that allows us to choose the type of result / either a standard result, or a detailed result by putting the type of the node.(standard) / (type of node (example = ticket)) (context) this field takes a string either the name of the context, the dynamicId or the staticId / (array) this field takes a list of strings according to your choice of fields (optionNodes from research)

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: choose an option among the three options, summary will give -note-the sum of tickets (part and equipment) by level of criticality-the sum of the alarms standard will give -Note -the list of tickets (part and equipment) with their name, note, -their workflow and their status -the list of alarms by equipment in the room detail will give  -Note -detailed list of tickets (part and equipment) -detailed list of alarms by equipment in the room

post.description: Find node object in a specific context by date

requestBody.description:
=> (context) use the dynamic ID
=> both fields (beginDate/endDate) are converted to GMT, so your search is a standard GMT query mechanism
=> Date Format is "DD-MM-YYYY", "DD-MM-YYYY HH:mm:ss", "DD MM YYYY", "DD MM YYYY HH:mm:ss", "DD/MM/YYYY", "DD/MM/YYYY HH:mm:ss"
=> the filter is applied to the directModifictionDate field
=> directModificationDate is date of direct change on the node, example = declare a ticket on the piece node
=> indirectModificationDate is change of a child or parent of the node, example = change a state of the ticket node linked to a piece node,
